svcproc.title: WORM AND ROLLER STEERING GEAR

figure.caption: Figure 1. Figure 1 - Worm and Roller Steering Gear

svcproc.para: Jack up the front wheels of the vehicle and inspect all linkage from the pitman arm to, and including, the wheel bearings for excess lash.

Turn steering wheel to straight ahead driving position. Secure steering wheel in this position and shake front wheel from side to side. This will enable any "play" in the steering gear bearings to be felt at the pitman arm ball. If any bearing "play" exists, the steering gear should be removed from the vehicle and adjustments should be made in the following sequence:

step1.para: Adjust worm and rollershaft total mesh preload.

svcproc.para: The preloads can be measured and adjusted with the steering gear on the vehicle, but it must be free of the steering system. Disconnect the drag link from the pitman arm and disconnect the input shaft coupling from input shaft.

warning.para: This steering gear weighs approximately 44 pounds (20 kg) dry. To prevent personal injury, exercise caution when you remove, lift, or carry it.

When using a chisel to spread the pitman arm boss to loosen the pitman arm for removal from the shaft, maintain a firm grip on the chisel at all times. Failure to do this may result in the chisel flying loose which could cause an injury. Never leave the chisel wedged in the pitman arm boss. If you cannot remove the pitman arm from the shaft with a chisel and your hands, remove the chisel from the pitman arm and use a puller only to remove the pitman arm.

caution.para: Do not pound the universal joint or input shaft coupling on or off the input shaft. Internal damage to steering gear can result.
